summary: The "Assisting In Developing Youth Employment Act" (AID Youth Employment Act) amends the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act to provide funding for subsidized summer and year-round employment opportunities for youth aged 14-24. It establishes competitive grant programs for states, local governments, and community-based organizations, outlining eligibility criteria, application requirements, and funding allocations. The bill emphasizes partnerships, program priorities, performance measures, evaluation, and reporting, with separate sections detailing summer and year-round employment initiatives, including provisions for tribal organizations and areas.
